questions.Name: Which guiding principle says that it is not usually necessary to build something new?
Which practice includes management of workarounds and known errors?
Which activity is part of the 'continual improvement' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: Prioritizing and creating business cases for improvement initiatives

Options.Name: Handling compliments and complaints from users to identify improvements
Improving relationships with and between stakeholders
Prioritizing and creating business cases for improvement initiatives
Identifying the cause of unplanned interruptions to service

questions.Name: Which practice establishes a channel between the service provider and its users?
Which practice includes conducting regular reviews to ensure that services are still appropriate and relevant?
A service offering may include goods, access to resources, and service actions. Which is an example of a service action?
questions.explaination: Correct: A service desk agent provides support to a user

Options.Name: A mobile phone enables a user to work remotely
A password allows a user connect to a WiFi network
A license allows a user to install a software product
A service desk agent provides support to a user

questions.Name:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence. 
A service is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating [?] that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks
In which step of the 'continual improvement model' is an improvement plan implemented?
Which statement about a service value stream is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: It integrates practices for a specific scenario

Options.Name: It uses inputs and outputs prescribed by ITIL
It is a service value chain activity
It integrates practices for a specific scenario
It provides an operating model for service providers

questions.Name: What term is used to describe whether a service will meet availability, capacity and security requirements?
Which 'service level management' activity helps staff to deliver a more business-focused service?
questions.explaination: Correct: Understanding the ongoing requirements of customers

Options.Name: Creating targets based on the percentage of uptime of a service
Understanding the ongoing requirements of customers
Using complex technical terminology in service level agreements (SLAs)

questions.Name: Which is a low risk change that has been pre-approved so that no additional authorization is needed?
Which describes the 'plan' value chain activity?
questions.explaination: Correct: It ensures a shared understanding of the current status and vision for all products and services across the organization

Options.Name: It ensures a shared understanding of the current status and vision for all products and services across the organization
It ensures that services are delivered and supported according to agreed specifications and stakeholders? expectations
It ensures that service components are available when and where they are needed, and meet agreed specifications
It ensures continual improvement of products, services, and practices across all value chain activities

questions.Name: Which practice has the purpose of ensuring that the organization's suppliers and their performance are managed appropriately to support the provision of seamless, quality products and services?
Which includes governance, management practices, and continual improvement?

Options.Name: The 'deliver and support' value chain activity

questions.Name: Which phase of problem management includes analysing incidents to look for patterns and trends?
What is a configuration item?
questions.explaination: Correct: Any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT service

Options.Name: Any financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of an IT product or service
Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service
Any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT service
A problem that has been analysed but has not been resolved

questions.Name: Which statement about the 'optimize and automate' guiding principle is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Automation frees human resources for more complex activities

Options.Name: Activities should be automated before they are optimized
Automation is best applied to non-standard tasks
Technology eliminates the need for human intervention
Automation frees human resources for more complex activities

questions.Name: Which statement about the 'service request management' practice is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Financial authorization is sometimes required for service requests

Options.Name: Service requests are fulfilled using simple workflows
A new workflow is created for each type of request
Additional approval is sometimes needed for restoration of service
Financial authorization is sometimes required for service requests

questions.Name: What is defined as any financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of a service?
Which dimension focuses on relationships with other organizations that are involved in the design, development, deployment and delivery of services?
What is a set of specialized organizational capabilities for enabling value for customers in the form of services?
Which statement about service requests is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Service requests are usually formalized using standard procedures for initiation, approval and fulfilment

Options.Name: Complex service requests should be dealt with as normal changes
Service requests that require simple workflows should be dealt with as incidents
Service requests require workflows that should use manual procedures and avoid automation
Service requests are usually formalized using standard procedures for initiation, approval and fulfilment

questions.Name: Which MOST helps an organization adapt ITIL concepts so that they apply to the organization's specific circumstances?
Which guiding principle considers which parts of an existing process should be kept by identifying how they contribute to value creation?
Which practice has a purpose that includes maximizing success by ensuring that risks have been properly assessed?
What is the MAIN benefit of 'problem management'?
questions.explaination: Correct: Reducing the number and impact of incidents

Options.Name: Restoring normal service as quickly as possible
Reducing the number and impact of incidents
Maximizing the number of successful changes

questions.Name: Which practice is responsible for moving new or changed components to live or other environments?
Which is part of the 'focus on value' guiding principle?
questions.explaination: Correct: Understanding what services help the service consumer

Options.Name: Understanding what services help the service consumer
Reducing the number of steps in the customer experience
Assessing services to identify parts that can be reused
Identifying activities that can be achieved in smaller iterations

questions.Name: Which guiding principle discourages 'silo activity'?
Which statement about 'continual improvement' is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Everyone in the organization is responsible for some aspects of 'continual improvement'

Options.Name: All improvement ideas should be logged in a single 'continual improvement register'
A single team should carry out 'continual improvement' across the organization
Continual improvement' should have minimal interaction with other practices
Everyone in the organization is responsible for some aspects of 'continual improvement'

questions.Name: Which will help solve incidents more quickly?

Options.Name: Escalating all incidents to support teams
Detailed procedural steps for incident investigation

questions.Name:
Identify the missing words in the following sentence. 
The 'incident management' practice should maintain [?] for logging and managing incidents
What varies in size and complexity, and uses functions to achieve its objectives?
What is a change schedule PRIMARILY used for?
questions.explaination: Correct: To help plan changes, assist in communication and avoid conflicts

Options.Name: To help plan, authorize and schedule emergency changes
To publish a list of service requests that users can select
To ensure that a single change authority reviews every change
To help plan changes, assist in communication and avoid conflicts

questions.Name: Which practice has a purpose that includes managing risks relating to confidentiality, integrity and availability?
Which practice facilitates operational communication between the service provider organization and users in the service consumer organization?
Which is included in the purpose of the 'service level management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: To set clear business-based targets for service levels

Options.Name: To maximize the number of successful service and product changes
To ensure accurate information about the configuration of services is available
To set clear business-based targets for service levels
To ensure that suppliers and their performance are managed appropriately

questions.Name: Which dimension considers the application of artificial intelligence to service management?
Which type of change is MOST LIKELY to be initiated as part of the 'service request management' practice?
